title: Me and Orson Welles
descriptions:
"Me and Orson Welles" is a 2009 coming-of-age drama set in 1937 New York City, directed by Richard Linklater. The film follows Richard Samuels, a 17-year-old high school student with a passion for acting. Richard’s life takes an unexpected turn when he auditions for and lands a role in Orson Welles’ groundbreaking Mercury Theatre production of "Julius Caesar."

Impressed by Richard’s talent, Welles, a charismatic and visionary director, casts him as Lucius, despite the chaos and pressure of mounting a major production. Richard is thrust into a world of theatrical brilliance and backstage drama, where he encounters a cast of colorful characters, including the alluring Sonja Jones, with whom he develops a romantic relationship.

As the production progresses, Richard faces challenges both on and off the stage. He must navigate the complex dynamics of the theater company, confront his own insecurities, and deal with the intense scrutiny of the media and the public. The film captures the energy and ambition of Welles’ innovative approach to theater, as well as the personal growth and self-discovery of a young actor finding his place in a challenging and exhilarating environment.
